content: Don't forget to set your clocks ahead one hour at 2:00 a.m. Sunday morning, or Saturday night before you go to bed. "The World's Finest"
reply: Don't forget to set your clocks ahead one hour at 2:00 a.m. Sunday morning, or Saturday night before you go to bed. "The World's Finest"

content: Just another way that the government can prove it is not "we the people," but that it can make "we the people" jump through just about any hoop it wants - including the "fork over the dough" hoop - - Wandering and Wondering

title: Daylight Savings Time

content: A couple of years ago, in the fall, I was driving home from some function. It was sometime between 2 and 3 am local (closer to 3) and I stopped at the only fast food place close by that had a 24 hour drive thru. When I tried to place my order, the voice said they were closed. I said the sign said they open 24 hours. She told me that because they had to set the clocks back, they were closed for hour. If they stayed open, they would actually be open 25 hours. I asked her how they made up the hour in the spring, since they were only open 23 hours the day we set the clocks up. She called a smartazz and suggested I take my food order somewhere else. I still go there once in a while. I always ask if they are open before placing my order.

She called a smartazz and suggested I take my food order somewhere else. I still go there once in a while. I always ask if they are open before placing my order.

content: In my younger days when the clock turned back, Saturday night out we got an extra hour to party... Now, it just gives me an extra hour to sleep. When they turn the clock forward, just makes summer days longer and hotter. And I sleep even longer.........

content: The one thing I like about Daylight Savings Time is the longer, sunlit days during the week where I can get work done outside around the house so I can go fishing (and drinkin') on the weekends. "The World's Finest"

content: quote: Originally posted by rangerdoug: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: just wish they'd stick with standard time and forget this "savings" crap. ME TOO! Roger that! I understand Arizona is nice this time of year. No time changes either. The worst thing about the time change is having the 0000-0400 fire watch (or ramp watch) or 0000-0800 phone watch when going off DST. You turn the clock back at 0200. I was never lucky enough to have duty when the clock was set forward at 0200. Rant over...
quote: Originally posted by rangerdoug: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: just wish they'd stick with standard time and forget this "savings" crap. ME TOO! Roger that!

I was never lucky enough to have duty when the clock was set forward at 0200. Rant over...

content: Sure screws up Sunday when ya fergit top set yer clocks ahead! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

title: Daylight Savings Time

content: quote: Originally posted by rangerdoug: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: just wish they'd stick with standard time and forget this "savings" crap. ME TOO! Roger that! Want to start a club? I hate the "spring forward". Just as we're starting to enjoy some lovely daylight driving in the mornings, they throw us back into driving to work in the dark. The older I get, the harder it is to drag myself out of bed an hour earlier. Every year, I try to start an insurrection against it, but so far, I haven't suceeded. Apparently, "the cheese stands alone". So, I've started coming to work a half hour later.
quote: Originally posted by rangerdoug: quote: Originally posted by Vicdude: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: just wish they'd stick with standard time and forget this "savings" crap. ME TOO! Roger that!
